title: A, B and C can complete a piece of work in 24, 6 and 18 days respectively. Working together, how long will they complete the same work? - Quora

response.answer_text: Rate at which A is working: 1/241/24 Rate at which B is working: 1/61/6 Rate at which C is working: 1/181/18 Above that 1 in fraction represents the whole work, So when they will be working together their rate of working will also combine: 1/24+1/6+1/18=19/72,1/24+1/6+1/18=19/72, Time taken by them to work together is reciprocal of above result: 72/19=3.7872/19=3.78 days

A completes the work in= 24 days(say a) B completes the work in=6 days(say b) C completes the work in= 18 days(say c) Using formula (abc)/(ab+bc+ca) we can calculate number of days they will take together (24*6*18)/(24*6+6*18+18*24)=72/19 days
A can complete work in 24 days then he can do work in single day = 1/24 Similarly B can do work in 1 day = 1/6 and C =1/18 Lcm of 24,6,18 is 72 1/24+1/6+/1/18 (3+12+4)/72 72/19= 3.7 days ( approx )
